page.title: 09Recreation - Newmarket (1)
page.content: Horse racing: There are two race courses at Newmarket. The Rowley Mile course dates from the mid 17th. century and is used during Spring and Autumn, and the July course, some 100 years old is used in the Summer months. They are situated on the Heath on either side of the Devil's Dyke. Approximately 146,600 people visit the two courses during the flat racing season. Many people are employed in the racing industry and on race days traffic is heavy with race- goers coming from many miles away nowadays. The Newmarket Town Plate, a race for amateurs, is run every year in October. It was instituted in 1665 by King Charles II who is reputed to have won it. Horse boxes are a common sight.
